solution_line_template: Mr. Mayer wants to get a ${cost_per_dog} x {profit_percentage} = $<<{cost_per_dog}*{profit_percentage}={profit_per_dog}>>{profit_per_dog} profit.
So, he will sell each Corgi dog for ${cost_per_dog} + ${profit_per_dog} = $<<{cost_per_dog}+{profit_per_dog}={selling_price_per_dog}>>{selling_price_per_dog}.
Hence, his friend should pay ${selling_price_per_dog} x {number_of_dogs} = $<<{selling_price_per_dog}*{number_of_dogs}={total_cost_for_friend}>>{total_cost_for_friend}.
